name: Hyatt Place Portland Airport / Cascade Station

reviews.text: Typical fall weather in Portland. A quick call to the property brought the shuttle to the airport. Trip was informative and short, ditto for check in. First time at this Hyatt Place.
reviews.title: It was a dark and stormy night

reviews.text: the pool (as those who've read my other reviews have come to expect) was really good for its size. Water temp perfect. I peeked at the workout room which also appeared better than average for Hyatt Place properties. Room lived up to standards. Location at cascade station is ideal. Although there were a number of guests (tour bus outside the next am), and it is parallel to the runways at PDX, the room on the backside of the hotel was quiet. This is where the SW Airlines crews stay, in the for what it's worth department. compared with the larger Sheraton across the way (I've stayed in those rooms and their suites), and the Embassy Suites (I've stayed in their suites and their larger suites) a bit closer to the terminal, this one wins because: it's newer, it's quieter, the bedding is superior.
reviews.title: Very Good for 2.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hyatt Place is a brand very well thought out. They have designed a hotel room to be more than a room, a little screen here, well placed desk, purpose made furniture give you the illusion of a suite with a living room when you just rented a room. Cascade Station by PDX has an IKEA caffeteria just down the street for your lunch folks! And the free breakfast was quite adequate for free. Free internet, free parking. Max station near. And with Occupy Wall Street now "Camp Down Town and Trash It" being indulged by the oh so tollerant government in Portland, being on the outskirts isn't bad for $119/night. Only thing, use the bed for 2, don't use the sofa bed for adults, it is very skimpy and so our 4 adult family had 2 well rested and 2 grumpy guests! Very good for 2, not so good for 4, although they did tell me they have 2 bed rooms that were not available for us, but I haven't seen them. If I can't get a Priceline 4* downtown for under $110, this is a very good second choice.
reviews.title: Great service in an smaller Hyatt

reviews.text: Located next to the airport, we stayed before departing and upon our return from an international trip, leaving our car for 2 weeks. The rate, which included parking, was very good. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. There is a free 24/7 airport shuttle. The facility appears to be new. Foods and drinks are available in the cafe attached to the front desk. Complimentary coffee is always available. The rooms are large and comfortable. High speed wifi is free. Other food and drink can be found adjacent to the hotel, with mall shopping across the street. Near IKEA.
reviews.title: Good PDX hotel.

reviews.text: Very clean and new inside. No wait to check in, friendly staff. Minisuite was clean and comfy and everything worked. Airplane noise stopped at 10 pm. This is my new hotel when flying out of PDX.
reviews.title: Adequate Hotel Very Close to Airport

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice now and each time was extremely impressed. Of course it helps that the hotel is only a couple years old but still feels brand new, that it's in a greal airport location, and staffed by friendly and competent people.
reviews.title: NEW FAVORITE PDX AIRPORT HOTEL

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Hyatt Place is great value

reviews.text: ROOM: spacious, clean, quiet, cordless phone, microwave, medium fridge, 50 inch HDTV with HD programming, heavenly bed, lots of counter space. Large shower (no tub). Vertical safe built into the tiny closet. I would love everyone of my hotel stays to be in a room like this.
reviews.title: New, nice.

reviews.text: HSIA: free wireless and wired (supply your own cable or check one out from the front desk.) Good speed.
reviews.title: Great Hyatt Place and Excellent Location

reviews.text: PHONE: free local and 800 calls
reviews.title: Modern hotel, near the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights on our 21 Anniversary celebration. Though there is no lounge/bar you can order a few drinks & beers @ the same counter where their refrigerated items are displayed..no cooking on site for lunches or dinners, but we discovered 3 restaurants within 1 block of walking; FAMOUSE DAVE'S, RED ROBIN & BUFFALO WING BAR & GRILL! Of course the wk/ends are busy @ each place, but we squeezed in @ the lounge @ Famouse Dave's!
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

reviews.text: The pool is 5ft max. depth and tastes salty, like they must use baking soda for cleanliness; it was not harsh on the eyes however. There is a unisex BATHROOM, unattached, from the pool or exercise rooms. It does have a shower. I miss this on first inspection & came down drip'n wet to the pool..... oops : >
reviews.title: stay here!

reviews.text: The free Wi-Fi was easy to use in our room. No problems with the micro, TV controls or hot water supply during showers! There are no close by theaters, but several new release movies (for purchase) were available!!! The shower head is a large as a giant Sun Flower, my 6'-5" Husband had no problems fitting under this! The room came w/tooth paste : ) along w/the usual shampoo, conditioner, soap bars & hair drier! Ice machines were on even numbered floors. We had fairly quiet rooms w/good temp controls; very clean & NO FUNKY ODORS.
reviews.title: Great value and service

reviews.text: The courties front dest help were definitly there to help us enjoy our stay! They didn't say a word when I came in for breakfast, from a morning swim, still wet (but clothed & in my right mind!) I was charged & ready to go!!
reviews.title: Good value, consistent, convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The business room is open to the lobby & no privacy door, which I loved! The laundry room was neat & a security door in place, accessible w/your room swipe card! I like that!
reviews.title: Great Hotel Airport.

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised to find such a nice hotel so near pdx. We liked that it was within walking distance of restaurants as well as numerous stores. The room was very roomy and pleasant and I appreciated that a double included 2 QUEEN beds. The free shuttle was very convenient and got us to the airport in under 10 minutes. Reasonably priced. Park and fly option.
reviews.title: Definitely would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before catching an early flight and found everthing to be excellent. If you'll be returning a rental car make sure you've refueled or you'll have to leave the airport area and it's not easy to find a gas station nearby. The front desk will give you a map but it's not the easiest to read. Right by the freeway to downtown, Washington State and the Columbia River Gorge.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel.

reviews.text: Blown away, excellent service - spacious rooms and comfortable beds. We were here picking up my wife from a girls trip to Palm Springs and when her flight was delayed offered us a late checkout so I wasn't watching my kids in PDX Baggage Claim. Staff were helpful and prompt, the rooms totally spotless and it had speedy internet which was another bonus. Rooms were well insulated I didn't really hear the airplanes landing/taking off which is a surprise considering the hotel is basically right over the main approach flightpath. Would stay again and will be staying at Hyatt properties more often.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: Friendly staff and clean rooms just minutes from the airport. A bit of a drive to downtown but thats what you get when you choose an Airport hotel!
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful, new, clean and in a fantastic location for shopping, dining and the airport.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

aka: Hyatt Place Portland Airport / Cascade Station Hotel Portland
description: Located within one mile of the Portland International Airport, and in the Cascade Station shopping area, the Hyatt Place Portland Airport/Cascade Station provides the ideal accommodations for anyone visiting Portland, whether it be for business or leisure. This cutting edge hotel is minutes from downtown Portland and several thrilling attractions including PGE Park, Oregon Convention Center and The Rose Garden (home of the Trail Blazers). For the business traveler, you will also find our location conveniently located within a few miles of several local Corporations such as Toyota, Rentrak and Boeing.
